body_html:
This looks a little confused to me:

grad_op = optimizer.compute_gradients(x1_var)

The documentation for compute_gradients is here:
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/api_docs/python/train.html#Optimizer
This method returns a list of (gradient, variable) pairs, not an 'op', and the results are intended for passing into the apply_gradients() method.

It doesn't make sense (at least to me) to call session.run on this?

The documentation for compute_gradients is here:
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/api_docs/python/train.html#Optimizer
This method returns a list of (gradient, variable) pairs, not an 'op', and the results are intended for passing into the apply_gradients() method.
It doesn't make sense (at least to me) to call session.run on this?
body:
This looks a little confused to me:
```
grad_op = optimizer.compute_gradients(x1_var)
```
The documentation for compute_gradients is here:
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/api_docs/python/train.html#Optimizer
This method returns a list of `(gradient, variable)` pairs, not an 'op', and the results are intended for passing into the `apply_gradients()` method.

It doesn't make sense (at least to me) to `call session.run` on this?
